# Goal of the script
This script reads the xlsx file (database techno-typological analysis) generated with E4 and formats the data for a statistical analysis.  
The script will:

1. Reads in the original xlsx file 
2. Changes the data (step #4) in order to do stats 
3. Plots the data and saves the plots as png files 


```{r}
dir_in <- "E:/EXPERIMENTS/tool-function_experiment/DATA/Inotec/R/raw_data/data_txt"
dir_out <- "analysis/derived_data/"
```

Raw data must be located in "`r dir_in`".  
Formatted data will be saved in "`r dir_out`".
The knit directory for this script is the project directory.

# Get name, path and information of the file
```{r}
data_file <- list.files(dir_in, pattern = "\\.xlsx$", full.names = TRUE)
md5_in <- md5sum(data_file)
info_in <- data.frame(files = basename(names(md5_in)), checksum = md5_in, 
                      row.names = NULL)
```

The checksum (MD5 hashes) of the imported files are:  
```{r, echo = FALSE}
info_in
```


# Read in original xlsx-file
```{r}
imp_data <- read.xlsx(xlsxFile = data_file, sheet = 1, startRow = 1, colNames = TRUE, rowNames = FALSE, skipEmptyRows = FALSE) 
#select the colums to keep 
keep_col <- c(1:2, 9:19, 21:35, 37:38, 40:43)
data_keep <- imp_data[,keep_col]

data_keep$length <- as.numeric(data_keep$length)
data_keep$width <- as.numeric(data_keep$width)
data_keep$thickness <- as.numeric(data_keep$thickness)
data_keep$weight <- as.numeric(data_keep$weight)
data_keep$perimeter.basis.back <- as.numeric(data_keep$perimeter.basis.back)
data_keep$perimeter.arch <- as.numeric(data_keep$perimeter.arch)
data_keep$perimeter.active.edge <- as.numeric(data_keep$perimeter.active.edge)
data_keep$perimeter.total <- as.numeric(data_keep$perimeter.total)
data_keep$thickness.back <- as.numeric(data_keep$thickness.back)

str(data_keep)

```

# Data analsysis - sorting  
## Dimension
```{r}
# keeps only colums relevant for dimensions and sorts them based on their technological class
keep_col <- c(2, 4:5,19:21)
dimensions <- data_keep[, keep_col] %>% arrange(technological.class)

KM_dimensions <- dimensions[1:191, ] %>% arrange(artefact.state)
KM.point_dimensions <- KM_dimensions[159:179,]
KM.only_dimensions <- KM_dimensions[1:158,]
KM.complete_dimensions <- KM_dimensions[1:179,]
PS_dimensions <- dimensions[309:335,] %>% arrange(artefact.state)
LSS_dimensions <- dimensions[192:308,] %>% arrange(artefact.state)
S_dimensions <- dimensions[336:347,] %>% arrange(artefact.state)


```

# Data analsysis - plots  

## Dimension  
### Dimesnion length
```{r}
# histogram Keilmesser length
KM.length <- ggplot(KM_dimensions, aes(x = length, fill = artefact.state)) + 
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 1) + xlim(20, 160) +
  labs(x = "length [mm]", y = "N", title = "", fill = "artefact state", size = 12) +
  theme_classic() +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept=mean(length)), linetype="dashed", size=1) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = wes_palette(n =3,name = "Zissou1"), labels = c("complete", "Keilmesser point", "semifinished product")) 
 
ggsave("KM.length.png") 
  
# histogram scraper length
S.length <- ggplot(S_dimensions, aes(x = length, fill = artefact.state)) + 
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 1) + xlim(40, 100) +
  labs(x = "length [mm]", y = "N", title = "", fill = "artefact state", size = 12) +
  theme_classic() +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept=mean(length)), linetype="dashed", size=1) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = wes_palette(n =1,name = "Zissou1"))

ggsave("S.length.png")

# histogram Pradnick scraper length
PS.length <- ggplot(PS_dimensions, aes(x = length, fill = artefact.state)) + 
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 1) + xlim(30, 80) +
  labs(x = "length [mm]", y = "N", title = "", fill = "artefact state", size = 12) +
  theme_classic() +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept=mean(length)), linetype="dashed", size=1) +

ggsave("PS.length.png")
```
